website_summaries.verdict: A first-rate mountain bike brake that's affordable and crafted to last.
pros: Made of rubber and aluminum alloy for performance in all weather conditions
Sand-guide grooves to reduce risk of wheel rim damage
each comes with 1 hex nut and 5 spacers
cons: Brake pads can be lumpy and bumpy

customer_reviews.title: It is really quiet
customer_reviews.text: No Noise - Whatsoever. I tried everything on a new bike to stop its embarrassing brake sound (front wheel) and it would not go away. I even sanded the wheel everyday and it only helped for a few minutes. Finally I looked for a no-noise brake pad and bought Alritz. It is absolutely quiet. I have used it for a few days and more than 20 miles with intensive braking on hilly roads but have not heard any noise. It is impressively quiet
customer_reviews.author: AN

customer_reviews.title: Good QUIET brakes
customer_reviews.text: The squealing from my promax brakes that came on my diamondback hybrid was driving me mad. I did everything from cleaning the rim , to sanding the brakes , toe in etc but nothing helped. Today I installed this set and the squealing is magically gone.. literally.. couldn't be happier. I have attached a pic with my old promax and as can be seen, the new brakes are substantially longer. I fully recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Know-It-All

customer_reviews.title: They wanted how much for brake pads????
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace the brakes on my commuter bike I was insulted at the price my local bike shop wanted to charge for brakes and installation took a chance and bought these very functional brake pads needed the extra pair due to one failing to install properly but they are well worth the money for all but the most elite of cyclist.
customer_reviews.author: Poes soul garden

customer_reviews.title: Insane stopping power, quiet as a church mouse.
customer_reviews.text: These pads are phenomenal. I had a bike that would scream in agony all the way down a hill, and it was driving me nuts. I ordered a set of these hoping they would solve the issue, and they absolutely did. You want to be able to speed headlong to the edge of a cliff, and then stop short because you changed your mind? These will do that for you. (Not recommended of course, this is an exaggeration of the stoping power I've found that these pads have.) You want to ride your bike down the steepest hill you can find, and still live to tell the tale? these brake pads will do that for you.
customer_reviews.author: A Man Who Shops

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace old dried up pads on my bike that hasn’t been ridden in 10 years. They came with all the hardware and even a little Allen wrench for installation. Brake pads stop with less effort on the lever and are quiet too.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony10370

customer_reviews.title: Color probably won't show.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about longevity, but stopping power after the initial install was great. The only thing I knocked a star off for was color. They're pictured pad to pad, so you think the color will be more visible. Unfortunately, the back side is black, so that's all you're really going to see. My kid loves red, so I was hoping to surprise him with a small pop off color on his bike. Sadly, he has yet to notice anything other than his brakes stop really well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: These brakes have worked every time
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I recycle bicycles and get them back out to our community through bike swaps. The bikes always require new, safe brakes. These brakes work great, are well priced for mass use, come packaged easily to use and easy to understand "right goes on right side, etc." I cannot recommend them enough. I have used them on mountain bikes, road bikes and 24 inches up w/o problem. Give them a try!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike pad replacements for those loud squealing brakes that scare pedestrians!
customer_reviews.text: Installed the first pair and viola, NO MORE annoying squealing sounds while applying the hand brakes from my bike. You can hear the sounds at one block or two away! The brake material feels like a bit more rubber-like vs my current pads. Thus far, they seem perfect for the job and at a great price for 3 pairs. Actually, I needed to swap my OEM brake pads because while riding, when I hit the brakes behind walkers on the path, the squealing sound was like an announcement that would scare them pretty good and make some folks jump LOL. Anyhow, these seem like they will do the job. Good luck! -pc
customer_reviews.author: SpaceGoat

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyday commuters
customer_reviews.text: It hasn't even been a year, my bike has eaten through all three pairs of these. I normally have to change my brake pads once a year, so I thought I was saving money. They wear down extremely fast. They do fine stopping my bike, but to have to replace them every three months is such a hassle. If you only use bike occasionally, these may be for you. If you use it more regularly, look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: They work, but wear down fast.
customer_reviews.text: These brake pads are not that great. I bought them for the price and the amount of brake pads you get. I thought I'd try them out. They mount easily and work great, no squeaks. The cons, for one the blue isn't really visible once the pads are mounted. Two they wear down fast, right away I started seeing the rubber wearing down on my first ride. I dont ride my brakes or slow down fast. If you want brake pads that are good and last spend the extra money on a good set. These may be what your looking for if you dont ride too often.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Valadez

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable value, but not ultra-top quality
customer_reviews.text: They are relatively inexpensive and work as I had anticipated. That's important to know. They c o u l d last a little longer, but that's not a big deal. These sort of brake pads are always a bit of work to install, but that not the fault of the manufacturer. Update on Dec. 31, 2019: I bike around 50-70 mi/week in urban areas, sometimes with groceries, etc. Over 12 months, I ran through one pair on front and back brakes, each.
customer_reviews.author: Raid Blunder

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about getting these because I didn’t know if they would fit my bike exactly and they seemed too cheap. It took a little finagling to get it to fit right but they ended up working better than my original brakes and they don’t feel cheap at all. I wish they were more clear when buying how to install and how to ensure they are the right size.
customer_reviews.author: g123

customer_reviews.title: this does make noise and one of the brake pin got loose while installing.
customer_reviews.text: The brake pads do make the squealing noise, so it was not great for me as i uninstalled a working brake pad due to the squealing noise issue, cleaned up rim and installed this but one of the pads pin became loose rendering it useless. they do provide the extra for i guess that purpose. Noise issue did not go away, faint squeal is there, which i am sure after cleaning the rim with soap and water, previous old brake pads would have done the same.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Check that all three sets you receive are actually pairs
customer_reviews.text: Brakes look fine but I just noticed one of the pairs in the set is just two left side pads. I just noticed 2 days too late after the return window because I didn't need to use more than one set when I ordered these. Make sure you check all of your pairs when you receive these so you don't get caught off guard like I did. :(
customer_reviews.author: Cece

customer_reviews.title: I won't get these again.
customer_reviews.text: The price was great and reviews where good so I bought them. But they didn't perform as advertised for me they squeak like mad no matter what I tried. I cleaned the rim and pads, I towed pads in and out and every other angle but still there load. After I posted this review on April 23, 2018 I was contacted by alritz and they apologize that the pads didn't work for me and offered me a refund. So I would give there customer service a 5 star and the pads for me are 2 star.
customer_reviews.author: moses

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: Put two sets on my 5000 mile per year commuter last week to replace the last set I sourced from a certain auction site via China for about 3x the price. These are at least equal if not better than the set I last used. For the price, and wet dry performance on my rims, these can't be beat. I will use them again next time around (likely in fall) Well labeled for direction and the hardware is just as good as any for these throw-away pads. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Fishmonger

customer_reviews.title: You probably won't find a better choice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bot the 3-pair package, so need 2 packages to do the front and back for two bikes. Good stopping power right after install. Have used for a 100 miles and no detectable wear, but that's not really a good distance for evaluating longevity. However they are much better than anything I have bought off the shelf at local bike shops and chain stores.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Good Brakes, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: No need to buy overpriced brakes. These are very good quality and come with everything you need to replace your old brakes. I don't understand the strategy of 3 sets per package but I guess it "encourages" you to buy at least 2 packs. I'll be ordering my second pack soon. Just wanted to make sure they were good. For the price, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Randy B

customer_reviews.title: To big
customer_reviews.text: To large for any 700mm or 26" rims I know of, radius on the top of the pads are more like for a 16" wheel (see photo). Pads take up whole brake area on the rim. Slight wear will add to the size due to the angle they are cut and will make contact the tire and painted rim area very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Noway

customer_reviews.title: They work fine but ...
customer_reviews.text: They were fine, but I had to use the nuts and washers from the old outgoing pads because the new ones were too long. So don't throw away any old parts until you are done. Installing is easy enough, it took longer in my case because I had to find out I needed to use the old nuts and washers. Durability? Remains to be seen.
customer_reviews.author: Tamuka

customer_reviews.title: works as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased those brake pads for my son's bicycle as his had lost the function. I was too worried about his safety when he was riding the bicycle without break. The product arrived pretty fast, and I installed them immediately. The installation was very easy. It only took me 10 mins to complete. Also, it worked. The only thing i had concerned was the pads were a little bit big for the bicycle. But, it does work. I hope it can last longer.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: So far, SO good!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only just received, installed and tested and the difference between these and the terrible stock pads that came with my Schwinn Solara 700c are remarkable. Yet to do some long distance and hill testing but will report back once I have. But for now, quite impressed.
customer_reviews.author: @ipfmcd

customer_reviews.title: Quite Pads
customer_reviews.text: I have a bike touring company with 22 TREK hybrids in my fleet. From the first day the pads that came with the bikes would squeal no matter how I adjusted them. Sometimes they would work the night before and make noise the next morning. Trek replaced them but the problem persisted. Upon installing these on two of my bikes and towing them slightly to the front (like every other brake pad I have ever dealt with) , they are quite and stop great. I plan to replace all of my pads with these.
customer_reviews.author: Bill de Bike

customer_reviews.title: Great brakes for a great price...
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product...easy to install, no squeak, came in a pack with 3 left pads/3 right pads (they can be used in the back or front of the bike.) I watched a video on youtube and installed without any problems. The whole project took about 15 minutes or so since I had to adjust the break line. But they worked great. I called a local bike shop and got a quote of $50 to replace the brakes...so the price for these was right in the budget. Thanks so much!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Long overdue upgrade/maintenance item. Huge improvement in stopping distance and brake feel. Tips: At first I tried to swap the pads by loosening the whole assembly. This made it really difficult to get the washers and nut on the replacement. I dropped them several times. but luckily I was able to look at the others still in the packaging. On the other side, instead of releasing the noodle, I left the assembly in place and pressed each pad against the rim for removal and replacement.
customer_reviews.author: AH_CA

customer_reviews.title: Poor product that is cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Did not meet my expectation at all. This one was longer than I expected. Mechanic said the lengthy doesn’t matter. Tried putting this together. It was a tedious job to get this together, despite the long effort didn’t work at all. Worst of all, when I tried removing it ripped apart. Worse experience.
customer_reviews.author: Vinodkumar Nagarajan

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Decent pads but not as quiet as the other reviews state. Bought these to replace noisy, squealing front brakes. Installed and adjusted (toe-in) on both front and rear. Honestly, there isn't much of a difference. Still have squealing front brakes. Brillo scrubbed and cleaned both rims braking surface before installation. These pads have a rough, gritty feel. If you need new rim brake pads these are as good as any other. But can't recommend to quiet noisy brakes.
customer_reviews.author: discountmopar

customer_reviews.title: Quiet Bliss!
customer_reviews.text: I used these pads to replace a set of screechers that came on my SE Bikes Blocks Flyer rear break. They were a direct replacement and I didn't even have to adjust the break at all, after the install. I am super happy with these pads and I have 2 more sets when the ones on my bike wear out! I'd buy them again if I ever have to, but Amazon may not even be around in 50 years when I run out of pads!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: work fine
customer_reviews.text: They seem to be working pretty well, I'll re-post after I can assess the durability. I've had them installed for about 2 weeks and I've put about 60 miles on them so far. Only thing is, I wish they sold them in sets of 2 pair - no one has a 3 wheeled bicycle so it's like the whole 12 hot dog buns and 8 or 10 hot dogs in a package, a marketing mismatch to make you buy more than you need.
customer_reviews.author: Bob from Ohio

customer_reviews.title: They worked well with modification
customer_reviews.text: Since a picture was provided showing a brake setup like mine I thought they'd work out of the box. They didn't. They were too loose. But adding spacers and reusing some old parts, then taking up the slack with the cable, I got them to where they'd work. And they're a huge improvement over the worn-out brakes I replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Vern Shellman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: Got this three pack to replace my rear brakes on my bike and keep a couple extra sets for future use. Went on with no problems and I was able to tune them very easily. Now my stops aren't squeaky and I can stop much more efficiently. I'd recommend these to anyone looking to replace theirs.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Fast wear
customer_reviews.text: I ride my bike around 40 miles a week on hilly terrain. These breaks have only been installed on my bike for around two weeks, which half of the time I was riding the bike was in wet conditions. The breaks have easily worn down over half in that short time, leading me to write this bad review. Do not buy these breaks, they wear quickly. The cool blue color isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: EnjoyLife

customer_reviews.title: Great brake pads
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described: no noise, no skid. The fact that this set comes with a 3rd pair is odd yet wonderful. I think it is because front brakes wear out faster than rear ones, so they require more frequent replacements. The 3rd pair is there for when that time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for 3 sets of v brake pads!
customer_reviews.text: Mounted these to my Specialized mountain bike in just minutes....have been using them for 3 weeks without a hitch. Smooth quiet stops, and couldn't be happier. Not sure how long they'll last as this is my first purchase, but for what it's worth I'm already planning to get more for my other bikes!
customer_reviews.author: Tricia R

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement pads
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, and better quality than the ones being replaced. Will reserve judgment on the durability until they've been used for a while longer (but the initial impression is that they are going to be just fine).
customer_reviews.author: James M. O'Connell

customer_reviews.title: Functional but not great
customer_reviews.text: The metal spacers and conical washers accompanying the pads are of low grade metal and fracture easily. The brakes provide adequate stopping power in dry conditions, in wet conditions they are nearly non functional.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Rhine

customer_reviews.title: Little bit of sanding needed
customer_reviews.text: After the initial install they squealed REALLY LOUDLY. I ended up taking them off, scraping against the concrete driveway a bit, and putting them back on. Now they work really well, are quiet, and my son can stop his bike again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Mast

customer_reviews.title: Good stopping power
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the tiny manufacturer provided brake pads on my kids' 14" bike and 18" bike with these. The ones that came with the bike didn't have much stopping power unless you squeezed the brake pretty hard. That's tough for little kids. These provide much better stopping power, even on hills or when the kids are riding really fast.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous and damaging. Don't do it. These are terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I found metal shavings on them when cleaning them, looks like they're grinding my rim. So, worse than a waste of time, they're actually ruining my bike. They wore down to almost nothing in less than two months. I should have paid attention to other bad reviews. Swapping them with Shimano pads immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Dabbler

customer_reviews.title: These are great. I replaced my brakes on my jamis commuter ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I replaced my brakes on my jamis commuter I with them. I watched a youtube tutorial and did this myself. I am a middle aged woman and am not exactly mechanically inclined but it was super easy and now my bike stops when I press the brakes. YAY!
customer_reviews.author: lilleth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are a perfect replacement for the pads that came on my Cannondale mountain bike. You can't see the color of the pads unless you get right down there to look at them but having a colored pad does make inspection a lot easier than black pads. They do an excellent job of braking with no noises and, so far, minimal wear.
customer_reviews.author: DoItDave

customer_reviews.title: Good value, it's 3 sets not just one
customer_reviews.text: With a motorized bike I expect to burn brakes faster than usual, a functional economic option with extras to store in the bike bag is essential and this product fits the bill. Even included the hex wrench, can never have enough of those if you have bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Seven Toe Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy, better than original
customer_reviews.text: These go on in 5 minutes and I had never done a pair before. The correct Allen wrench is included in the package. And these pads are longer and should therefore wear better than the original. We put these on our sons’ BCA (Walmart) bike.
customer_reviews.author: ol' Roy

customer_reviews.title: They look good and fit well with all the necessary hardware (I ...
customer_reviews.text: They look good and fit well with all the necessary hardware (I had some left over) Just installed and they stop as expected, maybe better than the OEM. Durability is unknown.
customer_reviews.author: well done

customer_reviews.title: 🛑 you fast on your tracks!
customer_reviews.text: I repaired lots of bikes and these are great for the value. Very easy to put on and adjust. Still don’t know how long they last but the test drives are awesome 👏🏼 when you stop within seconds!!! ^_^
customer_reviews.author: ICe

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I DON'T KNOW WHY THEY DON'T SELL IN 4- PACK???? FOR SET OF 2-BIKES???? FRONT AND REAR BRAKES... NICE PRODUCT...BUT COMES IN 3 PACK. I WOULD LIKE TO GET PACK OF 4 OR PACK OF 10. TO SAVE MONEY. THANKS. PANKAJ
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice set of replacement cartridges with hardware--great value!
customer_reviews.text: shipped quick, as described...replacements for an older Schwinn MTB bike that was reconstructed for commuter service...these work well, and are a cinch to install--given tools, training and time to do the job right!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Dunn

customer_reviews.title: These make a huge difference!
customer_reviews.text: These brake pads work really well and make a huge difference. I've been thinking about getting a new bike with disk brakes, but since I've installed these I'm very comfortable with the brakes that I have.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as back-up sets of brake pads, but they're working out very well. They've stopped me from hitting a person, car, wall, horse, even a chupacabra several times. Well worth it for inexpensive brake pads.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Viita

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY - Truly Quiet Brake Pads!
customer_reviews.text: After trying more than a few brands/kinds and never totally stopping braking squeals, I finally found these. Not a single noise, great stopping power and a good value. The three pairs in a set thing is a bit weird, however oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Ken H.

customer_reviews.title: Great break for my bike.
customer_reviews.text: Its easy to install. I like the color, it adds accent to my bike and also make me know when its worn out. It holds really good when i brake. Plus has two xtra left if needed to replace in the future. Its worth the price. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality - Returned
customer_reviews.text: These are made of a lower grade of rubber, but even more disappointing is that the pads are not red dyed rubber. They are cheaply painted. Very low quality all around. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: JustTheFactsMaam

customer_reviews.title: good quality excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I guess the extra pads are so they can charge you a little more? or maybe they are so generous they don't want you to have to buy another set if the set on one wheel wears out before the other wheel? Or maybe they think we all have mountain trikes instead of mountain bikes? But they are good pads at a good price
customer_reviews.author: J.C.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great pads
customer_reviews.text: So far these are working great on my motorized bicycle, the pads I got on the bike from Walmart were virtually gone after one ride, these seem like more durable harder rubber and they came with an Alan key which is very helpful 4 stars for great pads, 1 star for including tools.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Cuz sometimes they wear out or get rusty or . . . .
customer_reviews.text: Inherited a 'left outside' bike that was mostly fine, but for whatever reason, the metal internal supports for the brake pad material rusted from within the shoe and were close to totally disintegrating. Enter the new shoes and begin a new phase of the bike's life. Snaz look, too.
customer_reviews.author: Barry J.

customer_reviews.title: Quality pads, no squeaks!!
customer_reviews.text: These pads work great! Bought a new Schwinn mountain bike and the stock rear brakes squealed and vibrated like crazy...got these pads and not only are they quiet, but now my bike stops on a dime!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: work great
customer_reviews.text: after replacing my brake pad with these, I know realized that I should have done this a long time ago!! super easy to install and work great. Probably took 5 mins to change the front and back (pretty sure it was less than that actually)
customer_reviews.author: Mero75

customer_reviews.title: Much Needed
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived timely and contained all pieces. No issues with product. Went on test ride after replacing the brakes and they worked fine. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: DadMan

customer_reviews.title: Missing hex wrench!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be good brake pads but the hex wrench was missing! There was a clear location for the wrench in the package. Just shows there is no check of what being packaged and shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: These are good
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to install. The pads are quiet and brake so much better than my old worn ones -- should have done this a long time ago. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: JJ-Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Beast
customer_reviews.text: Wow this thing's are a Beast to stop your bike i have a 29 mountain bike and will this hapens wen they go to work, also they dont make any sounds

customer_reviews.title: Appear to cause excessive rim wear
customer_reviews.text: The sets of pads that I received and mounted on v-brakes appear to have small pieces of metal embedded in the pad material. This caused a grinding sound I had not experienced in 45 years of cycling, when the pads contacted the alloy rims. I assume (based largely on the sound) that the rims were being worn at a higher than normal rate. In the end I couldn't take the grinding noise and quickly switched these out for a known brand. The problem is gone.
customer_reviews.author: C Scott

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Great! Just what I needed.. easy installation (from someone who knows nothing about bike repair).
customer_reviews.author: Mackbee

customer_reviews.title: Value and performance excellent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these brake pads and am very happy! These were about a 1/2 inch longer than my current pads, I knew that buying them hoping they would work. Stops quickly with no noise. major improvement in braking from my old pads. I did ding the review on easy to install. They not hard, but for someone with zero mechanic ability I could see them with a issue.
customer_reviews.author: John Dailey

customer_reviews.title: Razonable price
customer_reviews.text: It was prettybeqsy to install, however the difficult part was to align them. I do not like te quality of the product but the price is razonable.
customer_reviews.author: José

customer_reviews.title: These puppies are noisy!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought these so this is not statement if how long they will last for. However, they are very noise brakes. Not happy about that and My previous pads were black which resulted in black brake dust attaching to the pads. I don't know of that will shorten the life span or not.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. Easy to install and I like the fact that right or left are indicated on each shoe to indicate which one goes where.
customer_reviews.author: PRAG

customer_reviews.title: Love the blue color!
customer_reviews.text: Brake pads on my son's bike have been making noises. I replaced them with these. They look good and the noises stop. He's happy so I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: They're not made for motorized bicycles because they wear out too quickly.
customer_reviews.text: These brake pads are easy to install and don't squeak while stopping. They work well on my mag rims. They wear out quickly and I won't be using them again on my motorized mountain bike.
customer_reviews.author: Donald L. Wagner Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Love the red!
customer_reviews.text: These came packed very well. They had all the parts I needed to replace my sons brakes. The red looks really cool with his all black bike setup. They are even larger than his last pads so they have a bit more stopping power. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: heavystarch

customer_reviews.title: The best brake pads
customer_reviews.text: I just put this brake pads on my bike and when I went for a nice long ride men I tell you this pads are great they stop the bike on point just the way I love right on the dime I definitely recommend this guys get them you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: jose f.

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for O.E.M. pads
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased brake pads at a big box store, but they were of a different style, and did not perform effectively. These pads were a perfect replacement for the original pads, and cheaper than the other pads I bought.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT WILLIAMS

customer_reviews.title: Wear out in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these several times, and they consistently wear out in 2-3 months. I commute on city streets about 10 miles per day. I recently purchased another kind of pad and they have lasted much longer, so I don't think it's just the way I ride.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Hassler

customer_reviews.title: Good for light use. Pay more if you ride serious.
customer_reviews.text: Good replacement pad for typical riding. Not sure I would want them on my single track mtb. Screw post seemed a little soft, stripped one tightening up.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good Break, but VERY short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Definition of "you pay for what you get", having lasted only 2 months as a daily rider (should have been longer). They are good breaks as per their function, but even the guys at the bike shop said they should have lasted longer, and that was a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Az2Za

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and brake good...the perfect combination
customer_reviews.text: Three sets for under $10?! The value here is great. The pads are nothing fancy, but then again are any v-brake pads? There cheap in price, are good quality, and brake just fine. I honestly don't see any drawbacks to these pads.
customer_reviews.author: Mondo

customer_reviews.title: one week and all the red is gone...
customer_reviews.text: live on a hill after 5 days pads are down to the black, Shimano pads from Walmart last 2 months and still havent passed the wear line... no buy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Webb

customer_reviews.title: So far so good !
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, comes with Allen wrench. Feels high quality. After one e-mtb ride (heavy bike) they don't show immediate wear unlike department store ones. Department store disintegrated after one 3 hour ride.
customer_reviews.author: millennial tinkerer

customer_reviews.title: Work like they should!
customer_reviews.text: These are top notch pads. It is nice you get an extra set but I tend wear front and rear at about the same pace riding trails. Truly I have only had one long ride with them , but I was happy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Krauseneck

customer_reviews.title: Ok Pads
customer_reviews.text: the pads are a great deal but they arent designed the same as other big brands. at least it comes with a tool. the pads are symmetrical, so you could change one at a time, but supposedly there is an advantage to having the leading edge shorter than the trailing.
customer_reviews.author: Don Power

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap brakes for mountain bikes!
customer_reviews.text: Simple product for my mountain bike, easy to replace durability seems really good for how much i use my bike
customer_reviews.author: Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Great break pads for a 20” BMX bike
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Ordered for my sons BMX bike. Fit great Stops his bike as it should. And you het 3 sets of pads. Great deal so far.
customer_reviews.author: gabriel flores

customer_reviews.title: i can't say they are perfect, but i can testify these blue brake pads ...
customer_reviews.text: MY touring bike came with cantilever brakes and some odd brand of brake shoes that don't stop well. so i took a chance, and i bought these, wella, i can't say they are perfect, but i can testify these blue brake pads are a big improvement on what came on the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: So much better!
customer_reviews.text: After a ride or two, these pads are smooth, quiet, and have a linear pull. The ability to modulate the amount of braking is much appreciated in technical sections on the mountain bike. Great value as well!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Short Life
customer_reviews.text: They are cheap, but only lasted a couple of months of rainy commuter riding 14 miles per day. Most of the ride is on bike paths, so not braking that much, but this was during the winter (rainy) months in Seattle. I would choose a different brake pad if your bike is a daily rider or in wet conditions.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Great Brakes!
customer_reviews.text: These pads, are a very soft compound and grip rims like mad! I wonder if they make carbon pads? If you're still using rim brakes with alloy wheels these pads are FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.author: Crypto Que

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: perfect fit for my mountains bikes!! All 4 new on 1 bike, new fronts on the other - great braking power- will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Good break pads for the price you pay for them. I'm a heavy guy, so I need a lot of power on my breaking (using a lot of my pads when I do). I've been using this for 3 weeks and still looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Henrique Ellrich

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fix for my Squeaks
customer_reviews.text: Two other new sets from the local bike shop squeaked. These fixed the problem. I was also pleased that although I like the blue, the color is hardly noticeable on the bike.
customer_reviews.author: David Ingmire

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: They lasted 3 months. I have a 6KU fixie. The brakes the bike came with lasted more than 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: Berg&Lund

customer_reviews.title: Threads stripped under minimal torque
customer_reviews.text: The threads on the mounting bolt for the first pair of brake pads stripped out under minimal torque when I tried to install them. The second pair installed fine. Fingers crossed for the third pair when I get around to installing it.
customer_reviews.author: lillies

customer_reviews.title: Work as good as what came on the bike
customer_reviews.text: Item was just like advertised arrived on time and in perfect shape. Install was easy. Stopping is good even with wet rims and no noise will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Guy W W

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Smooth engagement, effective stopping power. I had to use the spacers from the original brake pads to have perfect alignment with the rim.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Nice and quiet...
customer_reviews.text: It's nice to have an extra pair in this set. I bought these just because my old shoes were super loud annoying squeaky. These ones are very quiet and stop the bike very quickly. I recommend them without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Ahnko Chee

customer_reviews.title: installs easily
customer_reviews.text: brake pads install easily and work nicely. brakes well even when wet. durability is another issue of course but it is premature to guess how long they will last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth and quiet. Better than originals.
customer_reviews.text: The original OEM Shimano brake pads started making noise (grinding, scraping, squeaking). These pads totally eliminated all problems. They are smooth and quiet and can stop the bike easily. I wish I had bought these sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Baker

customer_reviews.title: Look like goog value easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a good product plenty of contact area I am not sure how long it will last that is the acid test. Will be used on Goodwill beater bike, the new blocks an tires cost more than the bike, ha ha.

Made of hard-wearing rubber and aluminum alloy, these brake pads are supreme durable and long-lasting for all weather
Unique sand-guide grooves effectively prevent sand/stone damages to the wheel rims
Slightly curved design doesn't hurt the wheel and provide better stopping power, less noise
